blocks.content:
Hello

I'm currently a PhD candidate at the University of Alberta. My research focuses on using digital twin-based Extended Reality (VR, AR, and MR) to enhance fire safety management on construction sites, reducing construction workers' injuries and deaths, and property loss.

blocks.title: Developing a Digital Twin-based Framework for Construction Fire Hazard Recognition Training
blocks.authors: Kexin Liu, Mohamed Sabek, Gaang Lee, Max Kinateder, Vicente A. Gonzalez
blocks.venue: Proceedings of the International Symposium on Automation and Robotics in Construction (IAARC)

blocks.title: A scoping review of fire safety on building construction sites: current measures, practices and future research directions

blocks.title: A Fuzzy Expert System for Measuring the Degree of Lean Implementation in Construction Projects
blocks.authors: Rana Ead, Kexin Liu, Amira Saleh, Sena Assaf, Vicente Gonzalez-Moret, Farook Hamzeh
blocks.venue: Annual Conference of the International Group for Lean Construction

blocks.title: The Analysis of Construction Workplace Incident Fatalities Using Text Mining and Classification Techniques
blocks.authors: Sena Assaf, Kexin Liu, Zeyu Mao, Amira Saleh, Abbey Abellanosa, Yasser Mohamed

blocks.title: Optimization Algorithm Based on Subset Simulation for Resource Leveling Problem with  Multiple Resources
blocks.description: 1. Reformed the model of the Resource Leveling Problem by introducing interval rate variables as design variables to avoid using complicated repair operators when the logic between activities is violated; 2. Tested the proposed optimization algorithm in Matlab, the result shows that it can obtain greater improvement in the stability of achieving optimal solutions compared with the traditional Genetic Algorithm.

blocks.title: Evacuation Simulation for a High-Speed Railway Station During Construction
blocks.description:
• Built a BIM-integrated evacuation model in Pathfinder to simulate mixed evacuation of 2,400 workers and passengers during the construction phase.
  • Evaluated emergency scenarios (e.g., stair blockage and guided evacuation) to identify bottlenecks and flow inefficiencies.
  • Reduced total evacuation time by 23.7 seconds and improved efficiency by 10.16%, supporting data-driven safety planning and layout optimization.
